intro: Centrapalus galamensis, commonly known as the Galamense centrapalus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat destruction, it is considered a vulnerable species.
